DefaultApplicationURL

The DefaultApplicationURL struct provides a default implementation of the ApplicationURL protocol, using values from the CFBundleURLTypes property in the main bundle’s Info.plist.

  • urlTypes

    The URL types supported by the application. Each URL type may have zero or more associated URL schemes.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let urlTypes: [String]
  • allSchemes

    The URL schemes supported by the application.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let allSchemes: [String]
  • init(bundle:)

    Initializes a new instance that will use the specified NSBundle for determining the supported application URLs.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public init(bundle: NSBundle)

    Parameters

    bundle

    The NSBundle to use for determining the URLs.
  • init()

    Initializes a new instance that will use the main NSBundle for determining the supported application URLs.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public init()
  • schemesForURLType(_:)

    Returns the URL schemes associated with the given URL type.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func schemesForURLType(type: String)
        -> [String]?

    Parameters

    type

    The URL type.

    Return Value

    An array of URL schemes. Note that because an application can support multiple URL types, this may not be an exhaustive list of URL schemes supported by the application.
